projects.name: Bloqus Game Server
projects.description: Developed a server for the Bloqus game, that is itself an adaptation of the Blokus board game. This server was built on top of the existing game engine made by Yves Bailly in 2009 (available at https://bloqus.tuxfamily.org/). A tournament manager has also been developed.

projects.name: Epidemic Simulation - System Programming
projects.description: Developed an epidemic simulation in C based on 4 different programs communicating via signals, message queues, pipes and a shared memory. POSIX threads were also used.

projects.name: Wumpus Rational Agent
projects.description: Developed a Rational Agent for a game like "Hunt the Wumpus" taking place in a 2D grid environment.

projects.name: Archery game
projects.description:
Developed a simple archery game in Java in a purposely limited timeframe. Supervised a group of 8 people including architects, version control managers and developers. 
 The goal was to build a software following the SOLID principles and implementing various design patterns when needed. Proxy, Strategy, Template Method and Decorator design patterns were implemented.

projects.name: Film library software
projects.description: Developed a film library software where data are stored in a SQLite database.

projects.name: Programming Challenge - Race driver
projects.description: Programmed a race driver in the C language interacting with a race manager program by using standard input and outputs. Implemented the A* algorithm. Ranked 2nd out of 29 race cars.

projects.name: Discussion server
projects.description: Developed a HTTP discussion server in C, using WebSockets. The client side with user interface was made in Javascript.

projects.name: Image color table inversion program
projects.description: Developed an image color table inversion program. Two approaches were taken: a naive one and one implementing a kd-tree based algorithm.

projects.name: Supervised personal initiative work
projects.description:
Knowing the number of vehicles crossing a road intersection, what is the best road infrastructure to reduce a driver's average waiting time? 
 Implemented a simulation of various road intersection models using a cellular automaton (yield sign, stop sign stop, traffic lights and roundabout). Characterized congestion phenomena and waiting time trends obtained with the various different models. Compared experimental results with actual measurements.
